description: Dive into "Picture-Perfect Phuket Town Adventures" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture-Perfect Phuket Town Adventures

places.generalDescription: Nestled atop a hill, the Khao Rang Viewpoint is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking breathtaking views and a serene atmosphere. This picturesque spot offers sweeping panoramas of Phuket Town, its stunning coastline, and the enchanting offshore islands. Surrounded by lush greenery and the soothing sounds of nature, it‚Äôs an ideal place to unwind with loved ones while watching the sunset paint the sky in vibrant hues.

sources.snippet: Located in the northwest of the city center, the Khao Rang viewpoint offers an excellent place to look out over the town, neighboring islands and hills that make up the ‚Äòspine‚Äô of the island (where the Phuket Big Buddha sits.) There are three restaurants and bars at the viewpoint along with a panoramic terrace where all the mentioned views can be had. For those feeling energetic there is also a fitness park to be explored as well.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Phuket (Thailand)

sources.snippet: Viewpoints in Phuket are very popular to capture the beautiful seascape from an elevated position. A glorious Phuket sunset from this viewpoint would be an idyllic experience. Photo credit:  Tourism Authority of Thailand
sources.shortName: Phuket Town (Top 25 things to do)

places.name: Khao Rang Viewpoint

reviews.text: Another wonderful viewpoint in Phuket. It's located by a temple and you'll have a great view from here on a part of the island and the sea. Parking is easy and you don't have to climb stairs to get to the main viewpoint. There are some nice restaurants on site as well with delicious Thai food and desserts.

One of the best scenic spots in Phuket if you want a full panoramic view of the city. A great place to stop by whether you're a traveler or a local looking for a quiet break.
The viewpoint is set up like a peaceful garden with lots of places to sit and chill. It's perfect for a picnic, reading a book, or just enjoying the breeze. Getting there involves a bit of a steep drive, so be careful on the way up. If you visit in the morning, there's a good chance you'll be greeted by a few playful monkeys near the entrance. Highly recommended for a relaxing stop with beautiful views of Phuket!

In the jungle, among the mountains, there is one of the highest points of the island, on which a very unusual and beautiful structure resembling a space station is erected - the Khao Rang observation deck. From here, an amazing view of the island opens up. It is especially unusual to be here at dawn and after the sun has set, when the city is illuminated by hundreds of thousands of lights.

It is very green and beautiful here, and the air is fresh and healthy - that is why there is a fitness park here. Monkeys live on the territory of the park, which will beg for food - feeding them is not prohibited. There are interesting swings that are attached to the branches of centuries-old trees. In the gazebo, on the observation deck itself, you can cool off in the shade and get acquainted with the history of Phuket by looking up. Near the gazebo there are two cafes where you can dine while enjoying the beautiful view of the island.

Full information with video and convenient navigation - in the application üëâ PHUKETON

places.address: 145/5 Patiphat Rd, Tambon Wichit, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled within the captivating Hanuman World, Three Monkeys Restaurant offers a unique dining experience amidst lush greenery. The restaurant seamlessly blends into the natural landscape, providing guests with stunning forest views while they indulge in authentic Southern Thai cuisine. With two kitchens serving both Thai and Bali-inspired Western dishes, this exotic oasis is a must-visit for those seeking an unforgettable gastronomic adventure. The atmosphere exudes tropical charm, making it a popular spot for capturing Instagram-worthy moments.

sources.snippet: Seamlessly blending with its natural surroundings, Three Monkeys Restaurant is as exotic as the jungle that surrounds it. Combining bamboo and palm frond canopies, Three Monkeys Restaurant is idyllic for any Instagram feed. Food lovers will enjoy their authentic Southern Thai cuisine and its creative plating.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Restaurants in Phuket

places.name: Three Monkeys Restaurant

reviews.text:
Tree Monkey Restaurant, Hanuman World Phuket

This is already my third visit to this amazing restaurant - and it just keeps getting better! Today, we came to celebrate Father's Day with family and friends, and once again, Tree Monkey didn't disappoint.

We shared a spread of flavorful, beautifully prepared dishes. Some must-tries include the Steamed White Snapper in Chili Lime Sauce, the restaurant's famous Deep-Fried Pork Knuckle, Crispy Fish Salad, Roasted Spicy Pork Ribs, and for my son - a delicious Beef Bolognese.

If you're a coffee lover, don't miss their Espresso Coconut or the Coconut Smoothie Coffee - a refreshing and unique twist on your usual caffeine fix!

We chose to dine outdoors, enjoying a relaxing lunch with scenic views and live music from a talented Filipino acoustic duo that added the perfect touch to the atmosphere.

A special mention to Mr. MJ, our server - he was attentive, always smiling, and very knowledgeable about the restaurant and the activities inside Hanuman World. His warm service made our experience even better.

Quick tip: If you're a walk-in guest, make sure to register upon arrival. They do get a lot of bookings and reservations, but the process is super quick - just scan a QR code, fill in your details, and you're good to go!

This place is highly recommended for family gatherings, celebrations, or even just a chill hangout spot with great views and amazing food. We'll definitely be back again!

We had a delicious meal here today without even making a reservation. We were seated right away. The staff is super friendly and very welcoming. We noticed that many guests were quite rude to the staff and behaved rather arrogantly. Not pleasant to see. The staff is very welcoming, so treat them with respect! They go above and beyond and take good care of you. We had a wonderful meal in a unique setting. There was even live music, which wasn't expected on a weekday. You get a big 10!

The food was absolutely delicious! I especially enjoyed the Tom Yum Fried Rice with shrimp and the Shrimp Burger ‚Äì both were flavorful and perfectly cooked. Despite the restaurant being quite busy, it's spacious enough that I was able to get a table without a reservation.

The only downside was the ongoing maintenance work, which made the atmosphere a bit noisy. Also, the outdoor seating could really benefit from more shade or umbrellas to block the sun during the day.

Overall, it's a beautiful place with great food and a unique jungle vibe ‚Äì definitely worth a visit!

places.address: ‡∏≠‡∏≤‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ó‡∏£‡∏µ‡∏°‡∏±‡∏á‡∏Å‡∏µ‡πâ‡∏™‡πå, 105 ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏π‡πà‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà 4 ‡∏ñ‡∏ô‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏´‡∏°‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏á‡πÄ‡∏à‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ü‡πâ‡∏≤, Wichit, Mueang Phuket District, Chang Wat Phuket 83000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Phuket Old Town, the provincial capital of Phuket, is a historically rich area with an abundance of temples, shophouses, and small printing shops. The town was established during a period of prosperity driven by the valuable metal trade. Its scenic neighborhood showcases remnants of the island's colonial past and reveals the influence of Sino-Portuguese, Chinese, and Malay immigrants who prospered from the tin mining industry.

sources.snippet: Phuket Old Town is the provincial capital of Phuket, it is a historically rich part of town where you will see an abundance of temples (Chinese and Buddhist), beautiful ‚Äòshophouses‚Äô, small printing shops and a disused red light district. The Old Town was created during a boom many years ago when metal was a valuable commodity. The town itself is not that big so you can easily walk around it rather than taking any transport and has a large selection of restaurants to stop for something to eat.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Phuket (Thailand)

sources.snippet: Best Hotels in Phuket Town 20 Best Things and Do in Phuket Town 72 Best Restaurants in Phuket Town Phuket Town Shopping Phuket Town Nightlife Phuket Sunday Market
sources.shortName: Phuket Old Town ‚Äì A Walking Guide To Old Phuket Town

places.name: Phuket Old Town

reviews.text: Parking around Phuket Old Town is relatively easy. The buildings along the street have a strong historical vibe with vibrant colors and unique architecture - perfect for photos. There are also many souvenir shops where you can pick up local gifts. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Phuket - it's a great place to explore the local culture!

Phuket Old Town is a must-visit if you're in Phuket. The streets are full of beautifully preserved Sino-Portuguese buildings, colorful murals, unique cafes, and local boutiques. It's a great place to walk around, take photos, and enjoy the laid-back atmosphere. The Sunday Night Market is especially lively with street food, handmade crafts, and live performances. A perfect mix of culture, history, and local life. Don't miss it!

This was my first time visiting Old Town Phuket, and I loved it! The colorful old buildings give the place a unique and charming vibe.

I enjoyed the mix of cultures - from authentic Thai food to Italian, Japanese, and Middle Eastern options, plus lots of coffee shops. Shopping was also great, with affordable souvenirs, clothes, and handmade gifts.

The Sunday Market is a must-visit. Go in the late afternoon until it closes around 10 PM. It's lively with music, street food, and hundreds of stalls.

Overall, Old Town Phuket is a beautiful and welcoming place, perfect for photos and exploring. Highly recommended!

places.address: Thalang Rd, Taladyai Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Phuket Old Town Sunday Night Market Walking Street is a vibrant and diverse market located in the heart of Phuket's historic Old Town. This bustling market, which opened in 2013, showcases the rich cultural tapestry of the Sino-Portuguese community along with Indian, Chinese, and Muslim influences.

sources.snippet: Phuket Walking Street: This market features traditional local foods, Thai handicrafts, modern fashion and souvenirs. Sundays, 4 PM - 10 PM.
sources.shortName: Where to Eat, Sleep, and Play in Phuket Old Town

sources.snippet: Located in the centre of Phuket Old Town surrounded by charming buildings. The Walking Street Market offers a large showcase of delicious street food and shopping sections featuring souvenirs, handcrafts and street performances from different cultures around Asia, making it a one stop destination for any evening. Located on Thalang Road every Sunday from 4pm to around 10pm.
sources.shortName: Phuket Town (Top 25 things to do)

sources.snippet: The Phuket Sunday Walking Street Market located in Phuket Town is a highly sought-after tourist attraction. This 360-meter-long marketplace has become an instant hit, providing a much-needed event in the historic district. Thalang Road, which was previously tranquil, transforms into a bustling street every Sunday from 4 pm to 9 pm, and sometimes even beyond.
sources.shortName: Phuket Old Town ‚Äì A Walking Guide To Old Phuket Town

sources.snippet: Vanich Walking, or ChimJae, Street is a long and narrow passageway located between two buildings which connect Thalang and Phang Nga Road in Phuket Old Town. This passageway is lined with vendors selling a variety of items, from clothes and authentic thai souvenirs to local snacks. If you enjoy checking out local Thai markets, this is one not to be missed.
sources.shortName: 10 Things to Do in Phuket Old Town

sources.snippet: Known by the locals as Naka Market and sitting just a little way from Phuket Town is a night market like no other. There are all sorts of things to buy such as fruits, old curiosities, animals and clothes. A popular event with both the locals and tourists it is best to arrive late afternoon to ensure you get a good look around before it become packed.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Phuket (Thailand)

sources.snippet: When instagramming Phuket Town on Sunday, make sure to include an evening at The Old Phuket Town Walking Street on Thalang Road where you can enjoy a wide array of tasty street food, crafts, local goods, as well as live music and family-friendly workshops.
sources.shortName: Most Instagrammable Places in Phuket in 2022

places.name: Phuket Old Town Sunday Night Market Walking Street

reviews.text: According to me the Old Town was the best attraction of Phuket. We came here on a Sunday evening which happens to their market day. The buildings here were inspired by Sino Portugal architecture. Very attractive. Many buildings have converted into hotels, museums, cafes and restaurants cum bars. It was very very crowded even though many streets were only for pedestrians. One could find stalls of paintings, artwork, souvenirs and different type of food, fruits and exotic juices. At some place music bands were going on. In one of the lane there were about 30 chairs for foot massage. The entire area was lighted with colorful lights. It looked very pretty in the night. The ambiance was rocking. If you want to enjoy Indian cuisine then visit Amritsar restaurant.

The Phuket Night Market is a vibrant showcase of Thailand's heart and soul-where sizzling street food meets the charm of handcrafted souvenirs. As the sun sets, the streets come alive with color, aroma, and sound. The air is rich with the scent of grilled seafood, skewered meats, spicy papaya salad, mango sticky rice, and crispy Thai pancakes made right before your eyes. Every bite tells a story-authentic, bold, unforgettable.

Wander further and you'll find rows of stalls lined with artisan crafts: handwoven bags, coconut-shell jewelry, carved soaps, and quirky artwork by local creators. These aren't tourist trinkets-they're pieces of culture, made with skill and care.

The market isn't just a place to shop or eat-it's an experience. It captures the spirit of Phuket: warm, creative, and buzzing with life. Whether you're hunting for unique keepsakes or just want to eat like a local, this night market is a must-visit.

Amazing place to be on a Sunday. Very vibrant market with lots of options to eat and shop. Can easily spend 5-7 hours here - if it isn't raining. Parking is an issue, get there early if you have a car.

places.address: Dibuk Rd, Talat Yai, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Jui Tui Shrine, a vibrant Chinese shrine in Phuket, is known for its annual Vegetarian Festival. After undergoing renovations, the shrine now houses three large statues of different Chinese gods, with Tean Hu Huan Soy being the most prominent. The shrine's location was moved following a fire that nearly destroyed it years ago. Visitors can also see a firecracker house next to the shrine where people often throw burning firecrackers during celebrations.

sources.snippet: Walk along Ranong Road to visit the 200-year-old Jui Tui Shrine, which pays homage to the Taoist god Pak Tai and features intricately carved statues. Next door, the Kuan Im Teng temple honours the Goddess of Mercy with red walls, golden dragon pillars and incense-filled halls. Don‚Äôt forget to drop by Wat Mongkhon Nimit on Dibuk Road plays an important role in the lives of locals and is recognisable for its prominent golden Chedi ‚Äì a large, bell-shaped tower.
sources.shortName: Where to Eat, Sleep, and Play in Phuket Old Town

sources.snippet: Following a series of renovations the Jui Tui Shrine house three large statues, each of a different Chinese god, the most prominent of these is Tean Hu Huan Soy, the god of performing arts and dancing, Next to his statue are a dog and a chicken as they were said to be his favorite childhood pets. The shrine itself was not always in its current location but following a fire many years ago that nearly destroyed it they decided is should move. To the left of the shrine is a firecracker house, you will often see people throwing burning firecrackers during various celebrations.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Phuket (Thailand)

sources.snippet: Jui Tui Shrine is the most famous Chinese temple that plays a pivotal part in the Phuket Vegetarian Festival. This must-see place offers some incredible views and unusual opportunities to photograph the amazing exteriors and design of the shrine.
sources.shortName: Most Instagrammable Places in Phuket in 2022

places.name: San Chao Jui Tui

reviews.text: At a walking distance from old town, I visited in the evening. It closes at 8. Very beautiful decorated  Chinese temple witnessing history of Phuket. There are statues of lions at the entrance of the main temple. These statues have rolling stone balls in their mouth. I wonder, how these balls are carved out inside the mouth. There is a huge long trunk of a tree kept horizontally with a garland on it. I could not get the significance of it.
Visited February 2025 for Chinese New Year "Lucky Day" Free entry.  It is best to visit before 6 p.m. You can buy offerings and fireworks üéÜ üî•  on-site.
An important taoist temple in the region. Must visit if you are here. Inside, there is also a small shrine for the goddess of mercy. Make a donation to support if you can.

places.address: 283 Soi Phutorn, Talat Nuea, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Endless Summer is a delightful gem nestled in a stunning Sino-Portuguese mansion, brimming with historical charm. This vibrant concept store offers an immersive experience where you can shop for fashion, accessories, and home decor while enjoying delicious food and coffee. Located on Yaowarat Road in the heart of Phuket town, this heritage house doubles as a chic boutique and cozy caf√©. Its captivating architecture draws passersby who can't resist snapping photos.

sources.snippet: A boutique Sino-Portuguese mansion in Phuket Old Town, Endless Summer Phuket is a bohemian dream. Designed and managed by a team of women, the boutique features clothing & accessories from up-and-coming designers. The attached cafe serves delicious French croissants, healthy salads and outstanding coffee.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Restaurants in Phuket

places.name: ENDLESS SUMMER

reviews.text: Very charming place with great drinks and desserts. I recommend the p√™che Melba, very authentic and tasty. The shop has high class and sumptuous quality. The decoration and housing cushions, carpet, frame are elegant and trendy. The service was good and friendly. Recommended!
Absolutely amazing place! The owner has very good taste, all the clothing and accessories are so pretty and unique! Highly recommend for everyone to look around and do shopping of course.üòÜ

We were so surprised to discover this place. Everything seems like a distant Middle Eastern dream. The shop has an amazing collection of clothes, jewellery and home decor items. Also you must try their ice cream. It's one of the best I've ever had!

places.address: 175 Yaowarad Rd, Talat Nuea, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled near the charming old Phuket Town, the Phuket 3D Museum is an exciting destination that promises a delightful escape for families, especially on rainy days. This unique attraction offers an interactive experience where visitors can immerse themselves in over 95 stunning trompe-l'oeil wall paintings crafted by talented Korean artists. While it may be a bit pricier than other attractions, the joy of capturing hilarious poses and memorable photos makes it worthwhile‚Äîperfect for sharing on social media!

sources.snippet: Phuket Thai Hua Museum: Housed in a 1934 Sino-Portuguese building, the museum features galleries on the history of Chinese people in Phuket.
sources.shortName: Where to Eat, Sleep, and Play in Phuket Old Town

places.name: Phuket 3D Museum

reviews.text:
Went to Phuket 3D Art Museum
It was reasonably priced and the museum was nice and clean
A lovely young lady came around and took photos of me which was awesome
They have loads of pictures for you to have fun with
It was well worth the visit with loads of parking
You buy your ticket around the corner next to the stairs
Take the whole family for a fun filled few hours

I loved the place. We are two pensioners but our inner child came to life. It was so nice to take pictures. The lady came to assist us and she took the pictures. We really appreciated it. She even made some suggestions. Thanks for their kindness. The entrance fee for adults was 500 Baht.

It's way cheaper if you buy your ticket on Agoda- we got 50% off for a non refundable ticket.

We spend a good 3 hours taking photos.

Took 1 stars off because my mom slipped as the floor was too slippery and hurt her back. Floor is too slippery, and wearing no socks doesn't  help. Bring non-slip socks to wear as wearing shoes were not allowed. Another star off because there weren't any seating areas.

Staff don't speak English, making communication difficult. It's fun to do with family & kids. I don't recommend elderlies unless they are fit. No elevators,  you must be able to stand & walk.

places.address: 130, 1 Phangnga Rd, Tambon Talat Yai, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Delico Decoration Coffee & Restaurant is a trendy cafe located on the Bypass Road, offering a variety of coffees, teas, and delectable cakes. The interior boasts bold blue walls adorned with vintage chairs, oversized mirrors, and an assortment of decorative items. The cafe's glistening copper coffee machine and creative coffee presentations are truly impressive. In addition to its photogenic decor, the cafe also serves simple Thai dishes and provides friendly service.

sources.snippet: Located on the Bypass Road, Delico Decoration Coffee & Dessert is a stylish cafe with a great choice of coffees & teas, delicious cakes and a menu of simple Thai dishes. Inside the cafe, bold blue paint covers the walls and is accented by creative interiors of vintage chairs, oversize mirrors, collectors items and bric-a-brac. It‚Äôs a great place to stop for refreshments as well as upgrade your Instagram feed.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Restaurants in Phuket

places.name: Delico Decoration Coffee & Restaurant

reviews.text: Cute little cafe along a busy road. Nicely decorated. The prad kapow was delicious! We don't recommend the passion fruit coffee. The staff kindly swapped it for an Americano, I don't think the passion fruit was ripe. They also gave us complementary apple. Nice coffee ‚òïÔ∏è

Nice place, delicious food, crafted drink, cool design. Don't have too much parking space, so if car, have to park on the road. The design is just perfect, so many small details, big work! Recommended!

Accidentally stop by at this shop because of the heavy rain even has been riding past many times.
Beautiful shop for your ig feeds.
Staffs are so humble and good service.
Bright and well-decorated cafe and restaurants.

places.generalDescription: Monkey Hill Viewpoint, also known as Toh Sae Hill, is a forested hilltop in Phuket Old Town that offers panoramic views of the city. Visitors can purchase seeds and nuts to feed the roaming monkeys and enjoy the stunning sights from the observation platform. It's best to visit in the early morning or evening to avoid strong sun, and be cautious with belongings around the friendly macaques. The hill also features a shrine popular for seeking lucky lottery numbers.

sources.snippet: Also known as Toh Sae Hill, Monkey Hill is the highest hill in Phuket Town, there are about 400 macaques living on the hill and they live in little groups all over the hill. The monkeys are not know to attack humans but it you should keep an eye on your belongings. The bottom of the hill houses a shrine that is popular with Thai people, a lot of whom come here to ask for lucky lottery numbers, the shrine is in honour of three different holy spirits, Toh Sae Dang, Toh Sae Dam and Toh Sae Kaow.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Phuket (Thailand)

places.name: Monkey Hill Viewpoint

reviews.text:
Such a cool experience, especially seeing the monkeys-there were so many, and the baby ones were absolutely adorable! Even though we didn't climb all the way up since it wasn't too hot, the monkeys are all over the place, so it was still totally worth the visit.
Only on the way out did we realize you could rent them to take you with a scooter or taxi to the top-I wish that had been made clearer or offered at the entrance. That would have made the visit even better.
Overall, a fun and unique spot, definitely worth checking out!

This is a must see if you're in the area. Great views and lots of monkeys. Just don't get too close to the animals and don't bring food with you. If you bring water, keep it out of site of the monkeys.
You can purchase beverages and at the top and bottom of the hill. All the vendors were very nice and welcoming.

Nice trail with lots of old trees along the way to fill your lung with fresh air. Walk uphill till the view point but it's really an easy trail. The view point offers just average panoramic view to my liking probably because it was cloudy. It was fun to observe the monkeys' behavior from afar. Just beware of the monkeys as you walk. They did stop me as I walked by (I had a backpack but no foods) but not in an aggressive way. Walk calmly to the other side if they stop you, not make eyes contact, prepare rocks or a stick just in case work for me. Don't bring foods or if you do just to have some fun, be prepared to protect yourselves. I saw a group of group of terrified/fun seeking tourists bringing foods not knowing how to get rid of a huge monkey stealing their foods and blocking the way.

places.address: Ratsada, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Lard Yai Market, located on Thalang Street in Phuket, is a must-visit spot for travelers. This bustling market comes to life every Sunday evening, transforming the Old Town into a vibrant hub of commerce and tradition. Visitors can explore an array of stalls offering authentic Thai crafts, souvenirs, and vintage finds. From intricately handcrafted jewelry and clothing to decorative arts, there's something for everyone.

sources.snippet: Drop by Lard Yai Night Market for some shopping, or get your hands dirty at a Thai cooking class offered by a MICHELIN-approved restaurant. (¬© Shutterstock, Blue Elephant Phuket)
sources.shortName: Where to Eat, Sleep, and Play in Phuket Old Town

sources.snippet: Phuket Sunday Walking Street Market, or Lard Yai Market as it is known to the locals, is certainly one of the top things to do in Phuket Old Town and something that everyone should experience at least once. The market takes place every Sunday from 4pm - 9pm on the historical Thalang Road. The popular road is lined with food and clothing vendors.
sources.shortName: 10 Things to Do in Phuket Old Town
Most Instagrammable Places in Phuket in 2022

places.name: Lard Yai Market

reviews.text: Definitely one of the best markets in Thailand!!! So much variety and the prices were surprisingly good. Many food options both from street vendors and restaurants on the area. A must if you are in Phuket on a Sunday night!

This market made my visit to Thailand worth every penny once again! The food that the street serves will always push you to come back to this place even more! Also, the vendors and their hospitality is something we don't get to experience elsewhere. The food was soo delicious and quality wise, I couldn't wish better.. try food from every stall. Dont miss the bbq crocodile meat üòç and the korean honey fried chicken or something (do not remember the exact name). This street is comparatively cheaper than rest of the streets in Phuket. However, it closes at sharp 10. It is a very reasonable street for food and souvenirs

Phuket Walking Street-locally known as Lard Yai Market-is a vibrant weekly night market that transforms Thalang Road in Phuket Old Town into a colorful pedestrian-only fair every Sunday from about 4‚ÄØPM to around 10‚ÄØPM  .

---

üèÆ Why Lard Yai is a must‚Äëvisit

Heritage Setting: The market runs along a 350‚Äì360‚ÄØm stretch lined with beautifully restored Sino‚ÄëPortuguese shophouses, bathed in shifting neon lights-an Instagram dream come true  .

Iconic Entrance Gate: Look for the wooden, Chinese‚Äëstyled gate by the Phuket Road end of Thalang Road, with ‚ÄúLardyai‚Äù written in Thai, Chinese, and English-a popular selfie spot  .

Food Stalls Galore: You'll find regional treats like grilled pork, chicken, and squid skewers; fruit juices and Thai sweets (like mango sticky rice and khanom); and adventurous bites-locals even sample horseshoe crab salad!  .

Shopping & Souvenirs: Browse handmade T‚Äëshirts, custom flip-flops, novelty toys, jewelry, accessories, printed fabrics, and more-often by young local entrepreneurs  .

Entertainment & Atmosphere: Live music, karaoke, and street performances by local teens animate the evening-feel free to tip performers if you enjoy the show  .

---

üìÖ Essential Info

Detail	Info

Where	Thalang Road, Phuket Old Town (Talad Yai area)
When	Sunday evenings from 4‚ÄØPM to 10‚ÄØPM (often continues later)
Best Time to Arrive	Around 5‚ÄØPM, just after sunset and before peak crowds fall in
Entry	Free-bring cash, as most vendors don't accept cards
Duration	Plan to spend 2‚Äì3 hours, strolling, shopping, and eating

---

üåÜ What to Expect Around the Market

Soi‚ÄØRommanee, just off Thalang Road, is a charming lane of pastel‚Äëcolored heritage buildings, now home to boutique caf√©s and great photo backdrops. At night, lanterns cast a magical glow on the street  .

The area surrounding includes heritage caf√©s and restaurants-One Chun is a standout, offering Peranakan-style Phuket dishes in a restored colonial building (and even featured in the Michelin Guide Bib Gourmand)  .

---

‚úÖ Tips for Visiting

Wear comfy shoes for walking and moderate crowds.

Carry Thai Baht-cash only at most stalls. A nearby ATM can help if needed  .

Eat early if you want the freshest food options-and arrive before crowds peak.

Support performers-a respectful tip is welcome if you enjoy local music or dance acts  .

---

üß≠ Planning Your Visit

If your visit falls on a Sunday, the Phuket Walking Street Market is essential-an evening full of flavors, sights, and vibrant culture. Want to explore more? Nearby markets include Chillva Night Market (Thursday Saturday) and Naka Weekend Market (Sat Sun) for more shopping and street food

places.address: Thalang Rd, Tambon Talat Yai, Amphoe Mueang Phuket, Chang Wat Phuket 83000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Tiger Kingdom in Phuket offers a unique and unforgettable experience for visitors to get up close and personal with tigers in safe, caged enclosures. The attraction provides an opportunity to learn about these majestic animals, take a leisurely walk through the park, and even feed or take photos with the tigers. With premium insurance included in the ticket, visitors can also explore educational exhibits and enjoy a personal encounter with the tigers.

sources.snippet: If you have ever wanted to get up close to a tiger this is the place to do it, the Phuket Tiger Kingdom hand raises Indochinese tigers in captivity from birth until their final days. The tigers typically get fed at around 19:00 hours but it is also worth a visit when they open first thing to avoid the crowds. The kingdom has two restaurants on site should you be hungry, one of which allows you to look out at the tigers.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Phuket (Thailand)

places.name: Tiger Kingdom - Phuket

reviews.text: Amazing experience. Staff are very friendly and well trained to be around these big cats. You feel completely safe. A must do once in a life time experience. You get to choose to pet  various tiger sizes from baby all the way up to big or even a leopard. Interactions only last 10 minutes and they do take pictures for you on your smart phone for free.

I was finally able to mark this off my bucket list! I paid for the P-All package and was able to do the photos & videos with the Giant tiger, small tiger, medium tiger, large tiger & white tiger as well as the cheetah. I was scared but I was not going to back out! I am glad I did it & glad I got the staff to help me with taking my photos. The staff took amazing photos & videos of me & I could not thank them enough. I also had the photographer in one of the cages with me and they were able to send them directly to my phone and also gave me the USB for them. The wait was between 30 mins & 2 hours but we were able to walk right in after paying & receiving our tickets based on the wait list which was amazing. Overall we spent about an hour there which I thought was great because it was crowded. We got there about 11:30am. All of my pics & vids came out amazing. Some of the tigers were sleep but others were awake. I appreciated that. They also have great snacks to choose from. I had the gelato which was homemade & delish! The staff was great.

Tiger Kingdom is a beautiful and well-organized place, perfect for families with kids who want to learn more about these magnificent animals. The visit is mainly for the photo session, which might take only about an hour. We were able to take very nice pictures. If you're planning a trip here, it's a good idea to combine it with other nearby attractions so your day feels complete

places.generalDescription: Soi Romanee is a vibrant and colorful narrow alley in Phuket, previously known for its red-light district but now transformed into a trendy area filled with souvenir shops, cafes, bars, and street art. The Saturday night market on Soi Romanee offers an active atmosphere where visitors can enjoy local street cuisine and mingle with both residents and tourists.

sources.snippet: Just off the famous Thalang road is Soi Romanee (P), with all the colourful buildings that make it the most photographed street in Phuket. However, the most beautiful part of Phuket Town was the red light street and the gambling area. You can now stay at one of the small guesthouses or have a drink at a cafe while watching the permanent Instagram competition going on here.
sources.shortName: Phuket Old Town ‚Äì A Walking Guide To Old Phuket Town

sources.snippet: Once known as Phuket Old Town‚Äôs red light district and located just off the popular Thalang Road is Soi Romanee. This street is one of the most popular in Phuket with instagrammers and influencers often flooding it to capture the best photos amongst its colourful buildings.
sources.shortName: 10 Things to Do in Phuket Old Town

places.name: Soi Romanee

reviews.text: Soi Romanee is in Old Phuket Town where the Sino Portuguese architecture is very well preserved. Not a very long alley so you can explore in a very short time. Used to be a red light area and now it has been preserved as a touristy alley.
Lovely street that ends with a view of a beautiful wat. Other than that quite a touristy and short path
Old town phuket very clean and good for photos. Eating is expensive as compared with Patong and so are the shops.

places.address: V9PQ+5MG, Tambon Talat Yai, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83000, Thailand
